comments_since_last_sample.body: Congratulations for moving to new RV.🚐. Left beautiful memory at blue house. More fun coming at new environments🥰

Glad to hear the RV of your choice is on the way. Moving is not easy but with planning and organizing you have made me feel not to fear moving. The other thing is you prepared the children well ahead to embrace and look forward to the new environment and at the same time to say goodbye to the old. This, how to respond to change, is something they will treasure  through out their life. Ms. Reese though in this video. I wish you a blessed and enjoyable new chapter in the family
so glad that the correct sofa is coming its way 😊 maybe you can have am outdoor shoe cabinet so that mud or dirt won't get inside the RV 🙂 also like a tarp in the ground before entering the RV.
Making memories and chapters. Here's to your new beginnings Miller Family!

Que bonita la familia de ustedes ..no tengo mucho siguiéndolos entiendo perfectamente inglés pero no me siento segura escribiéndolo….  espero me conprendan y también que entiendan lo que les escribo porque me gustan mucho sus vídeos y hasta a veses cuando me siento triste los veo a ustedes  y llego a la conclusión que todo es posible ..saludos desde tx
Rainbow is watching over y’all !! Sweetest family !!  Glad you got some movers !! 🙏🙏🙏🙏
I'm SO happy that the RV folks are doing right by you guys and creating the L-shaped sofa that you initially ordered!

Wishing you well on the big move! Glad to hear you are bringing your beautiful piano, I was wondering. If possible store  your beautiful piano in a temperature controlled space to keep it in good condition, ie no huge humidity/temp fluctuation it could severely damage your piano otherwise. I had to store an upright once in prep for moving to my piano studio and had blankets all wrapped around our piano and it worked quite well to protect it on the move and keep it warm in a space that wasn’t heated. Just a Piano loving tip from a piano teacher that enjoys your videos. :)
Yes! Strong the lights! It helps even during Thanksgiving!
